intro: Anisomeris brachyloba, commonly known as the narrow-leaved anisomeris, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments and has small, narrow leaves that help reduce water loss. Its flowers are usually yellow or brown, and it produces small, dry fruits called achenes. Anisomeris brachyloba is adapted to survive in harsh, dry conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
